algorithm_technique: Convert the sentence to a set of characters and check its size against 26.
problem_summary_simple: Does a sentence contain every letter of the English alphabet at least once?
problem_summary_technical: Checks if the number of unique lowercase English letters in the sentence is exactly 26.
key_insights: A pangram contains every letter of the English alphabet. Since the input only contains lowercase English letters, we need to check for all 26 unique letters.
Using a set is an efficient way to store and count unique characters.
The space complexity is constant because the maximum number of unique characters is 26, regardless of the sentence length.
